thread.title: Calgary science centre expands kids' adventure park with outdoor challenges
thread.title_full: Calgary science centre expands kids' adventure park with outdoor challenges - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Canadian Press
title: Calgary science centre expands kids' adventure park with outdoor challenges
text:
CALGARY - The Telus Spark science centre has expanded its outdoor adventure park for kids, the Brainasium.
The expansion — phase 2 of the attraction, which first opened in summer 2014 — adds seven new features, including a 28-metre-long logjam and giant molecule-shaped climbing blocks.
Experiences in the 0.4-hectare park explore sound, physics and simple machines, featuring obstacles that challenge children and "prime their brains for new learning opportunities," the centre says.
"Risky play combines fun and stress — turbo-charging brain development."
Other Brainasium structures include a six-person teeter-totter, an 11-metre-high rope tower and a 19-metre-long tube slide.
Entry to the park is included with general admission to Telus Spark.
